responseProcessing.data:
<responseProcessing>
        <responseCondition>
            <responseIf>
                <match>

                    <!--￼￼￼￼The value of RESPONSE is compared with the correct value identified 
                        in the RESPONSE declaration-->

                    <variable identifier="RESPONSE"/>
                    <correct identifier="RESPONSE"/>
                </match>
                <setOutcomeValue identifier="SCORE">
                    <variable identifier="MAXSCORE"/>
                </setOutcomeValue>
                <setOutcomeValue identifier="FEEDBACK">
                    <baseValue baseType="identifier">correct</baseValue>
                </setOutcomeValue>
            </responseIf>
            <responseElse>

                <!--￼Depending on whether the input matches the correct answer or not, FEEDBACK 
                    is given the value of the identifier of the appropriate feedback message-->

                <setOutcomeValue identifier="FEEDBACK">
                    <baseValue baseType="identifier">incorrect</baseValue>
                </setOutcomeValue>
            </responseElse>
        </responseCondition>
    </responseProcessing>

Which of the following elements are used to form water?
Which of the following elements are used to form water?

body.body: Open the gas on the stove
Poor the milk in the pan
Add 2 tea spoons of cocoa into the mug
Add 2 tea spoons of sugar into the mug
Add 2 spoons of water into the mug

Stir the water, cocoa and sugar until the
				mixture is smooth
Put the pan with milk on the stove
Poor the boiling milk into the mug

Put the mug with the mixture and milk into
				the microwave
Add milk to the mug with the smooth mixture

Add cold milk from the fridge into the mug
				with smooth mixture

Set the microwave on 700 Watt and set the
				timer to 2 minutes

responseProcessing.data:
<responseProcessing>
    <responseCondition>
      <responseIf>
        <isNull>
          <variable identifier="RESPONSE"/>
        </isNull>
        <setOutcomeValue identifier="outcome_2">
          <baseValue baseType="string">0</baseValue>
        </setOutcomeValue>
      </responseIf>
    </responseCondition>
    <responseCondition>
      <responseIf>
        <match>
          <variable identifier="response_1"/>
          <correct identifier="response_1"/>
        </match>
        <setOutcomeValue identifier="outcome_1">
          <baseValue baseType="integer">1</baseValue>
        </setOutcomeValue>
      </responseIf>
    </responseCondition>
    <setOutcomeValue identifier="SCORE">
      <sum>
        <variable identifier="outcome_2"/>
        <variable identifier="outcome_1"/>
      </sum>
    </setOutcomeValue>
  </responseProcessing>

body.body:
Log into tao. Go to the {{choice_gap_53578bf2d77fd699596930}} Create an item and select QTI item type.Go into the {{choice_gap_53578bf2d791f339694366}} to start editing your item.
Write some text in your item body editor. You can insert image, media and even {{choice_gap_53578bf2d7a36544077948}} elements in your item bodyInsert an interaction at some point and customized it. Let's start with the simplest one the Choice Interaction which is basically a {{choice_gap_53578bf2d7b4c606975478}} .Save it and preview it either in the {{choice_gap_53578bf2d7c64743787953}} , or the {{choice_gap_53578bf2d7d7a641140383}} . The result is the same, but going to the first one will have you leave the authoring tool so you gonna need to reload the authoring tool to resume working on. For quick review when authoring you item, prefer the second one.

guide him through the process of his first online assessment
creation.

body.body:
Lorna is flying back home to the UK. Ideally, she would like to fly in directly to her home town of Glasgow. Edinburgh is her second choice and, if necessary, she could fly into London and pick up an internal connecting flight. Although she has been offered a cheap flight to Manchester it remains her least favourite option as connecting flights to Glasgow are not very reliable from there.

{{interaction_graphicorderinteraction_53578bf2dff8f831710480}}

prompt.body: Mark the airports shown on the map according to Lorna's preferences.

responseProcessing.data:
<responseProcessing>
		<responseCondition>
			<responseIf>
				<match>
					<variable identifier="RESPONSE"/>
					<correct identifier="RESPONSE"/>
				</match>
				<setOutcomeValue identifier="SCORE">
					<baseValue baseType="float">2</baseValue>
				</setOutcomeValue>
			</responseIf>
			<responseElseIf>
				<match>
					<variable identifier="RESPONSE"/>
					<ordered>
						<baseValue baseType="identifier">DriverC</baseValue>
						<baseValue baseType="identifier">DriverB</baseValue>
						<baseValue baseType="identifier">DriverA</baseValue>
					</ordered>
				</match>
				<setOutcomeValue identifier="SCORE">
					<baseValue baseType="float">1</baseValue>
				</setOutcomeValue>
			</responseElseIf>
			<responseElse>
				<setOutcomeValue identifier="SCORE">
					<baseValue baseType="float">0</baseValue>
				</setOutcomeValue>
			</responseElse>
		</responseCondition>
	</responseProcessing>

attributes.title: The Space Shuttle, 30 years of adventure

body.body:
During more than 30 years, the American Space Shuttle transported 355 astronauts in space over 135 orbital launchings from Cap Canaveral, Florida. This 2046-ton Behemoth traveled 870 million kilometers around the Earth from 12th of April 1981 to 21st of July 2011. The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) built 5 Space Shuttles: Columbia, Challenger, Discovery, Atlantis and Endeavour.

{{interaction_choiceinteraction_53578bf32ea48307992453}}

prompt.body: Which was the last Space Shuttle going into space during the STS-135 mission in July 2011?

A chocolate factory produces several types of chocolate, some of which have nut centres. The chocolates are mixed together and are randomly packed into cartons of ten.

{{interaction_uploadinteraction_53578bf34263e939598524}}

prompt.body:
Build a spreadsheet to simulate 50 cartons of chocolates when each carton
                contains 10 chocolates, and when one-seventh of the chocolates have nut centres.
                Your spreadsheet should include 50 rows representing the 50 cartons, each row
                containing 10 columns to represent the chocolates.

body.body:
A chocolate factory produces several types of chocolate, some of which have nut centres. The chocolates are mixed together and are randomly packed into cartons of ten.

{{interaction_uploadinteraction_53578bf343e85731278349}}

Incorporate in your spreadsheet a count of how many cartons contain fewer than two nut centres, and hence estimate (to the nearest whole number) the percentage of a cartons containing fewer than two nut centres: {{interaction_textentryinteraction_53578bf3445f0653936071}}%

Scoring Guidelines{{img_53578bf345b71623588170}}

Max Score: 3.0 points

Scoring:

  • When not all 3 questions are answered in the response: -1 for each missing.
  • Check for gramatical errors: -0.1 per error.
  • Possibly add in .1 increments extra bonus points for extra good answers.

prompt.body: Write Sam a postcard. Answer the questions. Write 25-35 words.

object_53578bf347286266783394._alt:
Here is a postcard of my town. Please send me
a postcard from your town. What size is your
town? What is the nicest part of your town?
Where do you go in the evenings?
Sam.
